repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body:
looking at https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/d2dd403693e39396632c9b0446157bb8e71d4fef/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua#L1347 , I wonder if the line in this PR needs to change to : 


```suggestion
          local node = assert(parent:named_descendant_for_range(unpack(r:range())))
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -96,16 +96,22 @@ function TSTreeView:new(bufnr, lang)
 
   parser:for_each_tree(function(parent_tree, parent_ltree)
     local parent = parent_tree:root()
+    local start_row, start_col, end_row, end_col = parent:range()
     for _, child in pairs(parent_ltree:children()) do
       for _, tree in pairs(child:trees()) do
         local r = tree:root()
-        local node = assert(parent:named_descendant_for_range(r:range()))
-        local id = node:id()
-        if not injections[id] or r:byte_length() > injections[id].root:byte_length() then
-          injections[id] = {
-            lang = child:lang(),
-            root = r,
-          }
+        local start_row_, start_col_, end_row_, end_col_ = r:range()
+        -- Check if r is inside parent.
+        if (start_row < start_row_ or (start_row == start_row_ and start_col <= start_col_)) and
+            (end_row > end_row_ or (end_row == end_row_ and end_col >= end_col_)) then
+          local node = assert(parent:named_descendant_for_range(r:range()))

comment_data.body: `range()` returns varargs, not a table, so `unpack` is not needed.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -96,16 +96,22 @@ function TSTreeView:new(bufnr, lang)
 
   parser:for_each_tree(function(parent_tree, parent_ltree)
     local parent = parent_tree:root()
+    local start_row, start_col, end_row, end_col = parent:range()
     for _, child in pairs(parent_ltree:children()) do
       for _, tree in pairs(child:trees()) do
         local r = tree:root()
-        local node = assert(parent:named_descendant_for_range(r:range()))
-        local id = node:id()
-        if not injections[id] or r:byte_length() > injections[id].root:byte_length() then
-          injections[id] = {
-            lang = child:lang(),
-            root = r,
-          }
+        local start_row_, start_col_, end_row_, end_col_ = r:range()
+        -- Check if r is inside parent.
+        if (start_row < start_row_ or (start_row == start_row_ and start_col <= start_col_)) and
+            (end_row > end_row_ or (end_row == end_row_ and end_col >= end_col_)) then
+          local node = assert(parent:named_descendant_for_range(r:range()))

comment_regular_data.body: Can you please write a self-contained commit message (in  the format "Problem: ... Solution: ...")? And ideally add a test that fails on `master`? Otherwise this change is likely to get lost in the future.

Sorry for casually open this PR which appears to be more like a draft.

I am not familiar with the procedure of committing code to neovim so I wonder if I should close this PR and open an issue instead?

I have to say there might be something wrong with this line

```lua
local node = assert(parent:named_descendant_for_range(r:range()))
``` 

and my pr is simply a workaround.
You can `git commit --amend` your commit description, no need for a new PR. (Although if you do open a new one, please create a feature branch for it first.)

Thanks for your kind advice, but I think there might be something "deep inside", and instead of a shallow fix, devs like yours can fix thoroughly, you can close this pr as you like, thanks again for your patient reply.

It will save a lot of time to say what "problem" you are solving. 

> I have to say there might be something wrong with this line
> 
> ```lua
> local node = assert(parent:named_descendant_for_range(r:range()))
> ```

That's also my first question.

Is this change trying to check if `r:range()` is a descendant of `parent:range()`? If so, I would expect `parent:named_descendant_for_range(r:range())` to already do that.
Exactly, and I found in original code this function does not function rightly and I try to workaround it in this pr.
so can you please try the 1-line change i suggested? https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/33198#discussion_r2020191185
No, they are different, here `r:range()` correctly returns four integers which is the expected behavior.

> It will save a lot of time to say what "problem" you are solving.

The problem this pr solves is quite simple, `parent_tree` is paired with `parent_ltree` while for `parent_ltree`'s children their trees are independent with the `parent_tree`, resulting in separation of `parent` and `r`, they will be irrelevant if there are many `parent_tree`'s like the case `markdown_inline` and `latex` I mentioned above https://github.com/tree-sitter-grammars/tree-sitter-markdown/issues/147

But I think there are more to be done with the highlighting in markdown, not just a print command like `:InspectTree`, the separation between language trees and treesitter trees may result in unnecessary reparsing.

Here's a before (top) and after (bottom) screenshot with the issues in https://github.com/tree-sitter-grammars/tree-sitter-markdown/issues/147

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8be166de-6a3a-4437-ab43-8ea65f3c4e28)

Before the latex injection was being inserted into both paragraphs.

Looking more closely, given:
- a parent tree with range `0,0,0,9` (the first line), 
- a child tree with range `2,0,2,12` (the latext injection)

`parent:named_descendant_for_range(child:range())` is returning `parent` for some reason.

I'm guessing if the given range is outside the node, then the named descendant is the node? Seems wrong and should return `nil`.

Either way, I think this change is fine. Let me just push an update.
